name: 360 Fighters!
description:
TWO CONTROLLERS ARE REQUIRED TO PLAY!

This is a local multiplayer game where each player must attempt to 360 (or more!) no-scope each other. The more spins a player does, the more points the player gets for a kill!

Controls
  • Left analogue stick to move
  • Either trigger to shoot (only shoots if power >= 360)
  • Rotate the right analogue stick CLOCK-WISE to build up power
Credits
  • A game created by George Baron (@PixelbearGames)
  • Music by Kevin Macleod
  • Sound Effects created using BFXR
  • Created for the University of Sheffield Computer Science Society Game Jam
  • Made in 24 hours!
  • Created using Haxe, OpenFL and HaxeFlixel
Specs

I hooked the game up to an orange and it seemed to work.

...actually that's a lie. I developed it on a shit-top that could barely run it. A computer that isn't the equivalent of a brick should do the job.
